messages.message: hey everyone, i have a pr up for this ticket https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/70872 (~unittested but still have to test on crafting~ tested and in review) based on melissa's approach, but before this change goes into the next release, i imagine we would want the frontend to handle the errors, especially since it does change previous behavior. any frontend bandwidth for that?

we just need to edit the error toast to mention which table fields on which docs are in the wrong format, right?

if so, we just need to add `description` to this object (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/865bba1/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/hooks/appAccuracy/useRunAccuracyTest.ts#L32-L34) passed to `toastErrorWithReport`

you should be able to get the error response body from the `err` argument in that `onError` function, but you'll probably need to make these changes to satisfy typescript
• add `import ApiError from 'IBApi/utils/ApiError';` to the top of the file
• change `err: Error` to `err: ApiError`
    ◦ `runAccuracyTestApi` calls `fetchWithRetriesAndV1StyleErrors`, which calls `fetchWithRetries`, which throws an `ApiError` here (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/5eccaaa/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/lib/src/IBApi/utils/api.ts#L194) if the API returns an error response
then you can probably use `err.response.table_errors` to set `description` for the toast

can you make these FE changes since you already have tested the BE changes on your branch?
